comment: A bit belated, since I took this in 2021, but I just thought of this today. Half a year before Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the way Prof. Rotnem explained Putin's views on Russia's place in the world and relations with ex-Soviet satellites, you could see it coming. Not that it was inevitable, but that it could happen. Knows his stuff, for sure.

I took his 8am class and he tends to stray from the actual topic in lectures. It's hard to know what to study for tests bc he's rly vague and his study guides are useless. Get the textbook and study it as much as you can. There is an extra credit assignment so do that. If you aren't prepared for 100+ pages of studying for tests don't take him
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He, himself is not a bad professor however, his study guides are useless and he gets sidetracked so easy. Attendance is mandatory and uses lock down browser, I have no issues taking a test but it's so extra doing all that, if it's really that serious give use paper exams. won't take again. I have a 94% in the class if that matters.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Nice teacher, great teaching style. Knows his stuff. Exams and quizzes aren't based on general ideas, but rather examples that he briefly covers and your ability to learn/translate foreign language. Whatever you think is going to be on the test, you're wrong. He does give curves though, so hope you're not the only one that does bad.
rating_tags: Tough grader--EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things

comment: VERY VERY test heavy, this class is difficult because you have no homework, maybe 3 quizzes all semester and the rest is exams. you are expected to study countless pages of lectures and chapters at a time (I would say 200 pages) per exam, then he gives you a study guide that doesn't help. it is beyond vague. EXTREMELY difficult. study study study
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Rotnem's participation policy is very tough. After 2 unexcused absences your final grade goes down by a whole letter grade with each absence. He likes to tell his stories and is very engaging. His assignments are complicated but if you ask questions he will answer them and walk you through it. His tests are a little hard, but not impossible.

Prof Rotnem is engaging, but can get sidetracked. Bring your A-game for the tough exams. Attending class is key, and using resources like unstuck AI alongside the textbook really helps with study prep.

My fav professor at KSU. His teaching style isn't for everyone but I always found his lectures pretty engaging, bonus points for his sense of humor. Very doable work load. He clearly outlines what you will be expected to know on tests and I never felt unprepared for anything. Would def take again

I really liked Dr. Rotnem's course; it is not an easy course but Rotnem is a cool (and knowledgeable) guy. You will need to do a fair amount of reading, FYI. There is a group project of a world region and a simulation of democratization. If you like Model UN or NATO at all, you'll love the simulation. This is not an easy A class!

One of the worst classes I have had. I am taking him to graduate on time and his lectures and homework is absolutely ridiculous. He is vague on putting discussion posts in his syllabus only to bombard you with 2 of them back to back. On top of that, he calls them "mini essays" and expects book length posts. Also he monologues so now were behind.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: great professor, does get off course a good bit during class but never too much, and gives good constructive criticism on writings. Podcasts are also very good. Know how to pick a prime minister

Dr. Rotnam gives good hints at what will be main questions on the test or quizzes.  He is very passionate about the topics and it shows.  Attendance was mandatory but I missed more than three days and my grade didn't go down because of it, though the sylabus said it would.   Professor gives extra credit opportunities ... very good in all.

Prof Rotnem is one of those profs that tests on the tiniest details as opposed to the main ideas like most instructors...needless to say his tests are extremely difficult. He also likes to claim he's approachable and willing to help, but when I did this he told me to just read the textbook again. His lectures are also very hard to follow.

For a summer course, the class was very manageable. Professor Rotnem gives a clear overview of what's to be expected. There are five discussion posts that aren't difficult, and 3 quizzes and 2 exams that require lockdown browser. There are essay questions on the exam but he gives them out in advance so you have plenty of time to prepare.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: He's a nice guy and he knows what he's talking about, but he'll spend 10-15 minutes talking about something completely unrelated at least once every class. He's obsessed with Russia and will find a way to incorporate Russia into every. single. lecture. Our classes were 75min but we probably averaged about 45m of content and 30m of tangents

Rotnem goes off on tangents here and there during class and it slows down the material. 
So, take that test schedule with a grain of salt. 
He's not too bad content/homework wise, but you can definitely get away only showing up like 45% of the time. Brace yourself for Russia, he wants you to know the terms for that second test.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: I took POLS 4490 - Arctic Politics with Professor Rotnem and it was an awesome experience. The path to success in his class is clear from the start. He's always ready to help you when needed and if you go to class and listen you will get a good grade. Best part about it is his passion for teaching and dedication to making the class worth your time

talked 99% of the time for the lecture, but at the end of semester we had 2 major projects right before the final (which was also incredibly difficult.) you have no time to study for that w the projects. thinks his class is the only one. also told us no one can ever get above a 94 on participation bc "you can always do more" do not take him
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Rotnem was one of my favorite professors from all my time at KSU. His course was very lecture heavy, but all of which I found to be interesting. I took him in person and had class twice a week. He'd offer easy map quizzes often to give us a chance to raise our grades. If you study his lecture notes for the test you'll be fine. 10/10.

Comparative democratization was the first class that I had with Dr. Rotnem and it was because of this class that I would go on to take two other courses of his. This class is incredibly useful for anyone who cares about bettering their understand of what democracy is and why some states are democratic and others are not.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Dr. Rotnem is a professor who cares that you pass, but also that you learn the material. Therefore, while he is not an exceptionally difficult professor, you will have to earn your grade. But, if you actually care about your major, you will be grateful.

Nice gentleman but boring lectures. This was possibly due to the fact that it was offered online, but still monotonous. He might come off as snarky but he just communicates weirdly. He offers extra credit and is always available for help. Go to his study sessions and youll be fine.

Outstanding prof. Extremely knowledgeable on Russia and truly encourages students to study from a new and different perspective. A tough course, but you will be extremely knowledgeable about Russia and its foreign policy by the end. 10/10, I HIGHLY encourage EVERY IA student to take his Russia courses to gain a better understanding of intl politics

Great prof. As long as you attend lectures and take good notes, you'll learn a lot and get an A. Long and strenuous exams, but a generous grader. Rotnem is very knowledgeable on the topics, though he does tend to ramble on unrelated topics during lecture. Very fair and helpful. I've taken him several times, and would recommend to any IA student.
Really good professor, but you need to ask for extra credit. Make sure you do all the five-six discussion answers tho. Gives good hints on tests.
Ask for extra credit, because he is willing to help out. You have to turn in all asignments though.
Lots of work here, but great professor. Really communicates everything throughout class. Test review really helpful! Ask for one.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Great prof. Gets back to you really quickly. Very managable course.
Rotnem holds his students to a high standard, so long as youre willing to work for good grade, he will assist you along the way.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Rotnem was a good professor who challenges you to leave your preconceptions about east-west relations at the door to a degree. He is clear to state which perspective he is teaching, and he provides invaluable insight into east-west relations that digs far deeper than the typical Russia bad US good that we so often get from other sources.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Due to Coronavirus, the class was online. It consisted of 4 discussion posts (20% of grade), 2 online tests (60%), and a group project (20%). His study guides for the tests are ridiculously unhelpful and he does not allow notes on the tests, but he is passionate and very knowledgeable about the topic. If you get the chance, take his class in person
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: Took for POLS 4449 during an eight-week Summer semester. Four discussion boards, two exams, and a group project. As for reading, he gave us a list of 114 terms, several unhelpful lecture ppts, and made the test short; every question counts. Miss two questions, you fail. He is one of the rudest, most difficult, unhelpful professors I've had at KSU.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Comp. Democ - This was one of the hardest classes I took at KSU, but the prof. is super knowledgeable and passionate on what he teaches. I was struggling at first but he worked with me to get a B in the class. Expect to read strait from the text, lectures are packed with info from start to finish. Teaching style is straightforward. take good notes
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Russian Politics & Culture- Rotnem is an expert in this field, which shows in his lectures. This course is lecture heavy, 3 tests and a research paper, but totally doable. There's a lot of background history to cover first, but after completing the class I feel as if I can give a lecture on the subject. Hard class, reasonable grader, excellen prof.

Easily the worst professor I've ever had. Extremely narcissistic and doesn't seem to care about students at all. He grades tough and doesn't explain why he takes points off. Can't express enough how awful of a professor he was.

Covid 19 was hard on everyone & I think Dr. Rotnem did the best he could. I loved his class & I learned a lot. I'd recommend him, just make sure you read the book and take good notes and you'll pass the tests. The people tanking him are bitter.

Wouldnt take him again because of his tests and attitude. I spent everyday reviewing the 5-7 page study guides when they were out and barely got an A & B on the first 2 exams. The 2nd was online and he had the audacity to say we cheated. I did worse. The 3rd was insanely hard btw. The most snarky, sarcastic, condescending, rude professor at KSU.

I have taken 3 classes with Dr. Rotnem, and that says something. His classes are not easy, but if you take them seriously then you can get a good grade. Dr. Rotnem has never failed to assist his students. In fact, he has helped me several times with extra credit assignments. One of the best professors at KSU Political Science Department.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Rotnem is knowledgable about the course. After COVID-19 impacted our school, he tried his best to keep the same structure as we once had, but it just made things more difficult. After our first online test, he got upset with us because we did well, and he told students he knew we weren't being honest. He made test 3 super hard.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr, Rotnem was a wonderful professor. He is a fair grader and helps out a lot. Gives great feedback, and lectures are through. Make sure you are prepared for the exams. If you study they are not that bad, but if you do not they will be very difficult.

Dr. Rotnem is a GOOD professor. He is strict on grading and the material you should learn, but that comes with any class. He is very straight to the point , but that's not him being 'disrespectful' or 'sarcastic', it's just him letting students know what is expected. If you are not ready to take a college class, don't even bother taking this class.

Dr. Rotnem is a great professor, however, the material he teaches is very difficult. You have to really read the book and the lecture powerpoints. His study guides are very broad but only cover a few things. We also have to do a group project. I studied extra hard, knew the material, and still came out with a C. How? I do not know.

I was in the class that had to do online learning because of the Corona virus. He made voice over lecture recordings that we could access at anytime which was awesome. My class was harsh in their reviews. I believe that Prof. Rotnem is a good professor who really cares about what he is teaching and will help you if you need it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Cons: Group project where your grade is linked to the group performance more than your own. Pros: He is extremely knowledgeable and will help his students with extra credit, and curving tests when appropriate. People from Spring 2020 class are being far too harsh, and are mad about the pandemic, not this teacher's performance. Go head and register
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Rotnem was by far the worst profesional experience I've had. His classes are mostly lecture based and his tests are fair; however, he is very condescending and snarky towards his students and is very unconcerned with keeping private information private. If things don't go his way he gets very defensive...
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Rotnem is a great professor who cares and wants to see students succeed! I had a lot of health issues during this class and he gave me an incomplete so that I could complete it the next semester. He was quite flexible when working with me in regards to turning in my missing assignments. He is very helpful in his office hours.

The pandemic has affected everyone, including professors, and I've seen some students complain because they expected a higher grade to be handed to them. Dr. Rotnem was very fair and even let me make up a map quiz when I was out sick. If you think the workload for a major class is bad, consider changing majors.

So initially I was going to rant, but I digress. He released an announcement saying he would bump our test 3 grades 6 points to be fair because of everything going on, so I'll take it. HARD tests, weird grading, and he's sarcastic (but I don't mind that part). France's presentations deserved better. I hope he sees this and adds 2 more pts, please.

His class is tough. The group project is not as bad as people make it out to be though. Theres a lot of material to study but you can make an A. There are some easy quizzes to boost your grade. Depending on the situation, he will come through because he isnt looking for students to fail the course. He just isnt a teacher that gives out As.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Extremely difficult tests with vague study material. Study guides were upwards of 5 pages and just listed names and broad terms and concepts. Essay questions on tests were super hard and count for a lot. He is not accommodating whatsoever, and changed assignments on the syllabus late in the semester. Ridiculous group project. Avoid this prof
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: He takes pride in his students not doing too well on his test, which was really discouraging. Read that his tests were like AP exams and they really are. He wasnt very approachable to begin with and with the pandemic, his class only got worse. If you take him, good luck. That essay will either save or kill your grade.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Get ready to read

comment: Rotnem is a nice guy. He is respected in the department. He pushes his students, and wants the best from them... I liked him, but he was a very hard grader. He wants his students to be great! There are 3 map quizzes, 3 test and a group presentation. Good guy, I would take him!

Dr. Rotnem is not a very clear professor. When he lectures, he really dances around every idea. He posts very random and spastic announcements on D2L. I truly believe that he does not want all of his students to do well. He is very sarcastic and rude. When he grades, it is very unclear. No rubrics really given. Intense group project. Avoid.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Class has very little to do with comparative politics, instead you end up learning history lessons about different countries and then he gives a map quiz like this is geography, plus a group project in college is annoying by itself
Group project, rude to students, vague grading, not sure why this professor is so popular in teaching other classes

So you're going to have to do a group project for this class which is already annoying for college. He is rudely sarcastic and is little to know help if you ask questions or don't understand something. Class isn't that hard but he makes it needlessly harder, with meaningless quizzes that don't even relate to the class. Defiantly avoid.
Rotnem gave us extra credit at least two times. I didnt do it and I still did good in this class. I didnt show up much but he didnt seem to care at all.
I'm a pols major and didn't need this class, but I was glad that I was in it. I liked the group project. Class Simulation on Kuztarkastan wasthe Best!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: I thought this professor was pretty good. He has assignments due and sometimes they can feel like a lot, but you realize in the end he only assigns so much work because it's a lot of material to cover. He is reasonable and fair. I would recommend.
Great class!
Very good podcasts, but I wish he gave more. Loved the film on Ruanda, though it was depressing....
Dr. Rotnem gave us many chances to improve our grades, with at least two extra credit chances. I like the podcasts, too as they helped know what is important for the quizzes nd tests.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I honestly feel lucky to have a professor like Rotnem at Kennesaw. He's very intelligent and expects the same from his students. His test aren't hard, but it expects details in terms of explanations and he's a fair grader. Show up to class, participation, and you'll do well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Gives study guides and some extra credit. Simulation was fun, but too many people involved. (some didn't participate, so that made it easy to stand out!) Good class overall. Expects some reading, so make sure you do it!

Overall, the class and tests are rather simple if you want to do the work and use the course material. Dr. Rontem is quite a fair grader and responds to all work turned in with good responses and feedback. Just do what you're asked and you'll be fine -- especially use the study guides to help prepare for assessments.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Rotnem knows his stuff. He is very smart. His tests are HARD. He will also make you work for an A. There's a group project but it's easy. I highly recommend him if you're a POLS or IA major. Others strongly disliked him because he gave podcasts when he didn't finish lectures, but they weren't bad at all. You can't go wrong with him.

He isn't a good professor and he's condescending. He constantly compared students to each other in front of the entire class. The tests are more like AP exams. There are always podcasts because he goes on tangents. There is one 30 minute group project and he doesn't grade easy. Takes attendance but not consistently. The map quizzes are easy though.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Rotnem is not a good professor. He doesn't follow the material and wastes class time by going on tangents unrelated to the tests. Because of this, he makes students listen to podcasts outside of class because he lacks time management skills. The tests are hard and contain multiple choice, short answer, and a full blown essay.

He did not give any feedback for our discussion posts and rarely answered questions. When he did, it came with a short snippy remark. He does not give extra credit, although he claimed he would. Hard class but do-able, just avoid him.

He's really a great teacher. You need the book and to study the powerpoints. Three short essay questions in addition to test. Attendance required. Class is difficult if you do not read on your own. Cannot pass relying on just the PPT.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Great teacher! Would definitely take again. There are 5 map quizes, 2 written exams(midterm/final), 1 easy homework assignment, and a group project. We also had an extra credit opprotunity. The class is difficult but not impossible. And super interesting. You definitely get out what you put in to the class.

Rotnem is a good professor. I intensely disliked the group research paper, but he made himself accessible to help us out and gave us ample time to complete it. Rotnem may come off as snarky, but he is also incredibly knowledgeable and passionate about the subject, and the class reflected upon that. If you want to put in the effort, take this class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Rotnem is Awesome. He really knows his field. Hilarious guy, too. Intimidating study guide at first, but he gives it early on. Work on it from the get go and be pleasantly surprised when he tells you exactly what the essay questions will be. There is a group paper/presentation. He makes himself readily available SO GO TALK TO HIM IF YOU WANT AN A.

Easy summer class to take. Tests are hard if you don't use the book because I believe some of his questions he had made up himself. Not necessarily a quizlet easy A class where you copy and paste the answers. However, it was the best laid out class I have ever taken. Also, easy extra credit assignment at the end bumped me from an 88 to a 91.

I took this class over the summer. Really wasnt too bad at all. Three quizzes (and one syllabus quiz), three tests, and a number of discussion posts that you had to do.  No papers. Not a huge amount of work.  He did use lockdown for tests and quizzes so that was kinda annoying.  The tests are time consuming, took me almost two hours to complete.

One of the worst professors ever at KSU. Very condescending and sarcastic. He's also neve concise on what he wants/expects from the class. His tests are hard and he bombards you with online lectures and podcast. Waste of time. You can teach yourself better.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Hes a really great teacher! For some reason the class was once a week for almost 3 hours but class was always very interesting. Tests arent too difficult if you study. Hes friendly and helpful so I would highly recommend him as a teacher.

The use of Lockdown in the class is pointless, just use a separate device or physical notes. The study guides help a lot. The lectures are dry but consistent, sometimes he is late posting them. Rotnem is also very defensive so don't bother criticizing him or arguing in the postings. The book is needed to help with study guide, so get it and use it.

This class is not very hard. However, he often changed due dates, times and only allowed a small window to submit work. With the discussion posts, he would not clearly specify when they were due but would count it as late if you did not post when he wanted you to. It got very annoying by the end of the semester. Just something to consider.

He was great!  He was not easy and I had to study more than for most of my classes but I learned alot in this class and he really helped!  If you are majoring in political science I would highly recommend him for all your classes that you can take with him.  He's strict, knowledgeable, but very straight forward.  You know what to expect!

Subject WMD Class:  Dr. Rottnem is very knowledgeable and very passionate about the subjects he teaches. He had three papers in his class. As long as you do the papers and put some thought and relevant content into them you will do fine. Grammar is not really an issue unless it is repetitive minor errors or a major error. He won teacher of the year

I dont know where to start with this professor. He is a teacher that you can say a lot of bad things about him. If he was an English teacher i would understand him trying to correct an essay, he grades for grammar, capitalization and stuff like an English professors do instead of the subject matter at hand. I can not believe a person like him is co

I'm sure Dr. Rotmen is a good professor when it comes to politcal science... but for STS... Do not take him!! He grades extrememly hard and makes you feel stupid when you ask questions. He grades papers rediculously hard and if he does not agree with your opinion, your grade suffers! I worked harder in his 2 credit class than my 4000 level class!

The best professor within the department and probably the campus. Extremely knowledgeable in every field he teaches and he welcomes outside thoughts and discussions. Workload is extremely strenuous however you will not walk away empty handed.Simulation project in this class can become overwhelming, hammer him with questions and stay on top things.

Professor Rotnem is very knowledge able about current events and the subjects he teaches. He expects you to know how to write and conduct yourself as a college level student. He used APA with our class and the expected 3 page papers turned into 3-5 times that when finished. Attention to details when he assigns work and ask questions!
slides help keep everything organized. never bought the book and made a B. be sure to do the reserved readings. great teacher- always interesting topics.

I had a great time in this class. He's got a great talent for making things interesting that, otherwise, would make students in this gen ed class want to eat glass. He makes you realize the importance of the world around you and how important it is to stay up to date with events around the globe. One group project!
Great professor, loves teaching, and very enthusastic. He is one of the better teachers I've ever had, and very easy to approach outside class. Very knowledgeable as well
The Best One

He is VERY knowledgeable about political science and structures his lectures in a very logical way.  He prepares you for your tests with study guides and his summer calss doesn't have map tests :)  I recommend him highly and will take him for American Government.
He is a good professor and is very knowledgeable about this subject. He gives several extra credit opportunities and the tests are straight forward.

He is extremely reasonable, very passionate about the subject. One of SPSU best professors. He meets more than halfway. Just a great overall person and Professor. Cares about the people that surround him. I can only say good things about him.
Rotnem is HOT. His tests are fair and pretty easy if you paid attention in class.  He is open-minded and has interesting teaching materials.
Makes you think about the world you live in.  Read the book, tons of test question from the book but he does not tell you that.

Extremely helpful guy, is VERY passionate about his subject, and knows how to teach it.  In my opinion, he went just a tad fast on some topics, but overall, a very good guy.  I will probably get a B in this class, but I made a few dumb mistakes on the tests.  Attend class, study the powerpoints, do good on the final project, and you will be good
Wow, Professor McDreamy! Interesting class. Very clear what is expected. Tests weren't bad. + I've never had so much fun watching someone point at maps and graphs.
I took his class and former university and thought he was one of the best teacher's I ever had!  I hope I have an opportunity to take his class here.

I seriously thought I was going to failed the class because I made D's in the first two test but made A's in the map quizzes (they were very easy)... I guess I made a good grade on the third test that help me pass the class. By the way if you are going to take him do all the extra credit possible this helps a lot!!! He is a great professor!!!

Great Professor!!! test are kind of hard but has some  extra credit for students and has 3 map quizes which are easy A's. Study slides and articles that is all you need to do to pass not a lot of studying he makes the class interesting enough u can learn the material in class. Very helpful and loves what he teaches. "Political Science"
Very informative, helpful, and gave all around interesting lectures.

No cumulative final! You don't even have to take notes, just download them from his e-reserves. Very nice guy, knows what he's talking about; not boring. He gives tons of extra credit opportunities and curves some.  Awesome teacher, take him!

He is a good teacher. Try to stay awake during class and make sure you write down anything he writes on the board. You must go to class and read the e-reserve articles along with assigned chapters. If you study a day before the test you should be alright.

As others have commented, I am very impressed with his knowledge and he manages to always make the class interesting.  I would have to say that he is the smartest professor I have met thus far at SPSU, highly reccommended.  Remember as others have said Go to Class.

Makes you want to learn because he is so intreged himself. Extremly nice Professor, very smart political scientist. Goverment missed out when they didnt snag him up after college. Study and attend class is all he asks. If you attend you will learn. I highly recommend. I have taken twice now.

Awesome professor. He is highly intelligent. He is fair. He likes doing group assignments. And if you wind up in a group with idiots who don't do the work, just tell him and he will not penalize you if it is obvious you put in a lot of effort.
Great guy very interesting. Demands alot of his students and pushes you but very fair.
No Comments

He is extremely intelligent. I was very interested in his lectures simply because I could tell that he knew what he was talking about. I agree with everyone else - attendance is very important. I missed part of one class and was lost for a little while. But I would definitely take a class with him again!

Probably one of the smartest teachers at SPSU. Definitely an asset to the school. He basically gives you the test questions in his study guides. Study those and do the little e-reserve readings and you'll get an 'A' without problems.

The class is somewhat difficult, but manageable if you attend classes regularly and study the slides/notes. Lets you know in advance what material is on upcoming tests, just be sure to read all of the articles assigned.
Great teacher.  He tells you what is going to be on the tests.  Just study and you'll do fine.

Dr. Rotnem by far as been one of my favorite professors.  Do not go into this class thinking it is easy or that its a gimme.  You'll  have to work for it, but you go to class and keep up with the slides he gives in class you can't go wrong.
If you dont go to class you will fail.  Tests are hard if you dont study, but overall its a pretty easy class
He is semi difficult but u have to make sure u come to class and study the study guides.
No Comments
You had better make sure you attend classes and know the material on his tests or you are screwed.
Very interesting class.  Test are not easy, but should do well if you study the study guide.  Good professor.
Overhead lecture everyday; Tough tests
